## Description {#details}

A type to track pointer/struct usage and accesses for <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo">AAPointerInfo</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### addAccess() {#a0ec6e46ec669f364d2396241b5b7b2ae}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ChangeStatus llvm::AA::PointerInfo::State::addAccess (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/attributor">Attributor</a> &amp; A, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo/rangelist">AAPointerInfo::RangeList</a> &amp; Ranges, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp; I, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &gt; Content, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/aapointerinfo/#a78c4e7148167329c362738ab01ebdda1">AAPointerInfo::AccessKind</a> Kind, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42; Ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; RemoteI=nullptr)</>}>
Add a new Access to the state at offset <code>Offset</code> and with size <code>Size</code>.

The access is associated with <code>I</code>, writes <code>Content</code> (if anything), and is of kind <code>Kind</code>. If an Access already exists for the same <code>I</code> and same <code>RemoteI</code>, the two are combined, potentially losing information about offset and size. The resulting access must now be moved from its original OffsetBin to the bin for its new offset.

\\Returns CHANGED, if the state changed, UNCHANGED otherwise.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp/#l00852">852</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/ipo/attributorattributes-cpp">AttributorAttributes.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RemoteIMap {#a0f95c58e4dfb9965e55d8f8f02bfe729}

### ReturnedOffsets {#a2aeb8276fb7bbfcb10a9a365d4a82453}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="AAPointerInfo::OffsetInfo llvm::AA::PointerInfo::State::ReturnedOffsets"
  labels = {["protected"]}>
Flag to determine if the underlying pointer is reaching a return statement in the associated function or not.

Returns in other functions cause invalidation.
